Articles.Content:
After reading about flying wing aircraft in one of my Wikipedia session(you know, when you keep opening new articles until it's 2AM), I decided to try and build one in KSP. It required a lot of time to get everything right. It required also a lot of clipping, but I'mdefinitely happy with the result. It flies really well and also can go quite fast: I managed to get Mach 3,015 at about 20000 m. I only tried it with FAR, so I don't know how it will work with the stock aerodynamic. The only mod required is the fantastic B9 Aerospace.

So, in conclusion, I proudly present you my finest creation, the Flying wing Mk.II (the first one was a total failure )

I'm not at home right now, but if someone wants i'll post the .craft file later with the instructions on how to fly it

Instructions for takeoff:

Brakes on, engase SAS. Then throttle up to about 1/3 and fire the engines. Release the brakes. When the plane gets to about 60 m/s, go to full throttle and start pulling up. You're now in the air.

In-flight:

Nothing specific. The engines are powerful enough to go straight up. They will flame-out at around 20000m (maybe a little higher depending on the speed). Just remember, at high altitudes, the plane will have a tendency to flatspin(that's because it doesn't have any rudder). If you feel you're losing control, reduce the throttle and activate RCS.

Landing:

It's a normal landing. You want to touch the ground under 80 m/s. You can use the airbrakes by pressing 3

but i love your design. what did you do about the vertical stabilisation? hidden vertical ruder inside the fuselage?

Thanks Darth Lazarus. I didn't do anything for the vertical stabilization, actually. I added a reaction wheel, but that's just for landing. Otherwise, if you fly it, you will see some sideslip when turning. But that's not a problem to me. I imagined this plane for high altitude flying, with little to none changes in the flight path. I'll tell you more: this was only a test for my future SSTO with this design . The only things that I hid in the wings are...other wings. I needed to move the center of lift closer or the plane would just nose dive at about 7000m.

BTW, nice plane! Is it only stock parts? It's awesome, especially the tail looks really good
